hanzi-su-wiki:
彫

Значения

Вырезать, гравировать

Мнемоника

Насечка 彡 по кругу 周 есть гравировка.

Варианты

雕
purpleculture_pinyin:
diāo
carve, decorate; emaciated
вырезать, украсить; истощенный
rtega_mnemonic:
彫彫RS
雕雕		carve, decorate, emaciated
  • marks 彡 in a circle 周: carved decoration
purpleculture_examples:
精彫細刻 [ jīng diāo xì kè ]: lit. fine sculpting (成语 saw); fig. to work with extreme care and precision; also written 精雕細刻 |精雕细刻
彫刻 [ diāo kè ]: to carve; to engrave; carving
heisig_constituent: carve, circumference, running track, glass hood, earthenware jar, lidded crock, soil, dirt, ground, mouth, shape
heisig_story: The two primitives here, circumference and shape, belong naturally to the special connotations that differentiate carving from engraving (see frame 1639).
koohiiStory1: A lathe is used to carve a shape with circumference into wood or metal.
koohiiStory2: Start with a circumference and carve away until you get the shape you want.
jp_example_words:
彫刻(ちょうこく): carving, engraving, sculpture
彫る(ほる): carve, engrave, sculpture, chisel
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: There is a circumference around someone's hair, as in, you can see a circle drawn around the top of their head. As you examine it closer, and pull at it a bit, you realize that someone has carved the hair off someone's head!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Their hair has literally been carved out of their head, and you discovered it. Of course, the nastiness, the smell, and the feel should be applied to your imagination to make the mnemonic stronger.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: When you think of all the people who could have done this... all the people who could have carved out someone's hair, only one person comes to mind, and that is Mrs. Chou (ちょう). She's the only person evil enough to do something like this.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: You can also imagine Mrs. Chou doing the act of carving someone's hair out, but that may just be too much.
Ru_Notes: ср. с другим тё/гравировка? было ли оно?
Ru_Radicals: 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 土 (земля), 彡 (украшение)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the fur (彡) is on the circumference (周) of the sculpture

彫字的基本解释

彫
diāo
同“雕”②彫④。

彫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［diāo］
［《廣韻》都聊切，平蕭，端。］
(1)雕刻；雕镂。
(2)绘饰；涂饰。
(3)通“凋”。凋敝；萎谢。
(4)引申指憔悴。
(5)通“凋”。使凋残、零落。
(6)通“凋”。残破；残弱

Name meaning
Nothing.
diāo
вм. 雕 (гравировать)
Radicals: 周, 彡  (circumference, hair)
Meaning Mnemonic
There is a circumference around someone's hair, as in, you can see a circle drawn around the top of their head. As you examine it closer, and pull at it a bit, you realize that someone has carved the hair off someone's head!
Their hair has literally been carved out of their head, and you discovered it. Of course, the nastiness, the smell, and the feel should be applied to your imagination to make the mnemonic stronger.
Reading Mnemonic
When you think of all the people who could have done this... all the people who could have carved out someone's hair, only one person comes to mind, and that is Mrs. Chou (ちょう). She's the only person evil enough to do something like this.
You can also imagine Mrs. Chou doing the act of carving someone's hair out, but that may just be too much.
